definition:
Intentional acts of misleading or
providing false information to achieve goals, spanning human and artificial
agent behaviors.

relationships.opposite_rationale: Steer toward helpful action instead of deceptive action

opposite_reasoning: Honesty is the strongest and most direct semantic opposite to Deception. It captures the exact inverse: intentional truthful communication vs intentional misleading. This binary opposition is ideal for Fisher-LDA because it creates a clear axis (truthfulness-deception) that is maximally discriminative. For AI safety monitoring, this axis is fundamental - detecting deceptive behavior requires understanding what honest behavior looks like. Honesty has high availability in both WordNet and SUMO, and should definitely be added to the layers as a critical anchor concept. The μ_honest - μ_deceptive vector will create a highly interpretable and useful steering direction.
